A little about me

Hey there. I'm a self taught junior full stack developer. I never thought about becoming a developer until I tried some CSS to fix a Wordpress site I was working on. I always thought it looked like gibberish until I sat down and read about CSS. Upon learning the basics in a day, I thought well, this isn't as difficult as I thought. So I looked at learning JavaScript. Slowly but surely, I finally discovered what I wanted to do in life, and love learning about coding.

I'm currently looking to break into a development role, so if you could use a quick learning, self-motivated full stack developer;
get in touch :D.

Some skills that I've picked up so far

  • HTML
  • CSS
  • SCSS
  • JavaScript
  • TypeScript
  • jQuery
  • Node JS
  • Express JS
  • EJS
  • React JS
  • Gulp JS
  • SQL
  • Mongo DB
  • Python
  • Git
  • Command Line
  • Wordpress

Some projects that I've been working on

To do List React SPA

A simple to do list utility Single Page Application. You can add and delete to dos and mark them as done. There is an error check for an empty field being submitted. The app was made initially using class based components and then refactored to use React hooks. The version that uses hooks is saved on a separate branch.

Technologies used:

React (create-react-app), Emotion for styling.

Look at the Github repo Visit Website
Blog

An MVC based blog website with data persistence and CRUD capabilities. Hosted on Heroku. It's on the free tier so it might take a couple of seconds to load.

Technologies used:

Express JS for routing, Mongo DB Atlas for the database, Mongoose for CRUD operations, EJS for templating

Look at the Github repo Visit Website
Prayer Timetable app

A cross platform (MacOS, Windows, Linux) desktop app, made for a local mosque. It has a working clock, conditional highlighting based on the current prayer time, and native notifications for when the next prayer time starts. This was my first ever project so the codebase isn't the cleanest but I learned a lot from it, expecially the value of scalability and why organisation is key in a code base. Initially the data (times) was manually inserted and accessed via normal Javascript object handling syntax. This was recently changed to scrape the times from the website using axios to 'GET' the page, and an npm package called cheerio to select the elements needed. The web scraping version is saved on a separate branch.

Technologies used:

Electron JS, web-scraping (used axios and cheerio to build a Node JS based web scraper).

Look at the Github repo
Weather checker app

A super simple app that shows the current weather in a particular location, and a small icon of the description of the weather. Made using the openweathermap.org API. It has error handling to handle an API response of a 404 status code.

Technologies used:

React, Materialize CSS

Look at the Github repo Visit Website
Github user finder

A search app for Github users. Enter a username and see the results populate. You can then see more info about that particular user. Made using axios and the Github API.

Technologies used:

React, React-Router, Emotion for styling

Look at the Github repo Visit Website
Python Web Scraper

A simple web scraper made in Python. I've just started to learn Python, and this was a little app I made to scrape the new headlines from Reuters and output them to a CSV file.

Technologies used:

Python, Beautiful Soup (web-scraper), Panda (for outputting to a .csv file)

Look at the Github repo
Mexican Eatery

A responsive website for a mexican eatery I actually owned. The website is almost exactly the same as when it was open, but back then it was made with Wix, now it's been made from scratch using HTML and CSS rather than dragging and dropping.

Technologies used:

HTML, CSS

Look at the Github repo Visit website
This website!

A responsive website made to showcase some of my projects. A little script was added in to give conditional greetings based on the time of day. This website is only read by the most awesome people. Congrats! You're awesome! :D

Technologies used:

HTML, SCSS, JavaScript, Gulp JS to compile SCSS, minify CSS and JS, and optimise images.

Look at the Github repo You're already on this website!
